verses.kjv: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle, and were gathered together at Shochoh, which belongeth to Judah, and pitched between Shochoh and Azekah, in Ephesdammim.
verses.ct: The Philistines assembled their forces for war. They gathered at Shochoh, which belonged to Judah, and set up camp between Shochoh and Azekah, at Ephesdammim.

verses.kjv: And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and pitched by the valley of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.
verses.ct: Saul and the Israelite army also assembled and set up camp by the valley of Elah, forming their battle lines to face the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines stood on a mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.
verses.ct: The Philistines positioned themselves on a hill on one side, and the Israelites stood on a hill on the other side, with a valley separating them.

verses.kjv: And there went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.
verses.ct: A champion fighter came out from the Philistine camp — a man named Goliath, from Gath. He stood about 9 feet, 9 inches tall.

verses.kjv: And he had an helmet of brass upon his head, and he was armed with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.
verses.ct: He wore a bronze helmet on his head and was outfitted in a coat of scale armor that weighed about 125 pounds of bronze.

verses.kjv: And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a target of brass between his shoulders.
verses.ct: He had bronze leg guards and a bronze javelin strapped across his back.

verses.kjv: And the staff of his spear was like a weaver’s beam; and his spear’s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and one bearing a shield went before him.
verses.ct: The shaft of his spear was as thick as a weaver's rod, and its iron point alone weighed about 15 pounds. A shield-bearer walked ahead of him.

verses.kjv: And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel, and said unto them, Why are ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.
verses.ct: Goliath stood there and shouted at the Israelite army, "Why have you come out and lined up for battle? I'm a Philistine, and you serve Saul. Pick one of your men and send him down to face me."

verses.kjv: If he be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants: but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.
verses.ct: "If he can fight me and kill me, we'll become your slaves. But if I overpower him and kill him, then you become our slaves and serve us."

verses.kjv: And the Philistine said, I defy the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.
verses.ct: The Philistine continued, "I challenge the armies of Israel today! Send me someone to fight one-on-one."

verses.kjv: When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.
verses.ct: When Saul and all the Israelites heard what the Philistine said, they were shaken and deeply afraid.

verses.kjv: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehemjudah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man went among men for an old man in the days of Saul.
verses.ct: Now David was the son of a man from Ephrath in Bethlehem of Judah named Jesse, who had 8 sons. In Saul's time, Jesse was already an old man.

verses.kjv: And the three eldest sons of Jesse went and followed Saul to the battle: and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next unto him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
verses.ct: Jesse's 3 oldest sons had gone with Saul to the war. Their names were Eliab the firstborn, Abinadab the second, and Shammah the third.

verses.kjv: And David was the youngest: and the three eldest followed Saul.
verses.ct: David was the youngest. The 3 oldest had gone to serve with Saul,

verses.kjv: But David went and returned from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.
verses.ct: but David went back and forth between serving Saul and tending his father's sheep in Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the Philistine came forward every morning and evening to issue his challenge for 40 days.

verses.kjv: And Jesse said unto David his son, Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched corn, and these ten loaves, and run to the camp to thy brethren.
verses.ct: One day Jesse told his son David, "Take this basket of roasted grain and these 10 loaves of bread, and hurry to the camp where your brothers are."

verses.kjv: And carry these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and look how thy brethren fare, and take their pledge.
verses.ct: "Also bring these 10 blocks of cheese to their unit commander. Check on how your brothers are doing and bring back some proof that they're well."

verses.kjv: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.
verses.ct: Saul, David's brothers, and all the Israelite soldiers were in the valley of Elah, engaged in the conflict with the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the trench, as the host was going forth to the fight, and shouted for the battle.
verses.ct: David got up early the next morning, left the sheep with another shepherd, packed up the supplies, and headed out just as Jesse had told him. He arrived at the camp as the army was marching out to their battle positions, shouting their war cry.

verses.kjv: For Israel and the Philistines had put the battle in array, army against army.
verses.ct: The Israelites and Philistines were lining up facing each other, army against army.

verses.kjv: And David left his carriage in the hand of the keeper of the carriage, and ran into the army, and came and saluted his brethren.
verses.ct: David left the supplies with the man in charge of the baggage, ran to the battle lines, and greeted his brothers.

verses.kjv: And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the armies of the Philistines, and spake according to the same words: and David heard them.
verses.ct: While he was talking with them, Goliath — the champion from Gath — stepped out from the Philistine ranks and made his usual challenge. David heard every word.

verses.kjv: And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid.
verses.ct: When the Israelite soldiers saw Goliath, they all ran from him in terror.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel said, Have ye seen this man that is come up? surely to defy Israel is he come up: and it shall be, that the man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father’s house free in Israel.
verses.ct: The soldiers were saying to each other, "Do you see the size of this man coming out? He keeps doing this to mock Israel. The king has promised that whoever kills him will receive enormous wealth, the king's daughter in marriage, and his entire family will be exempt from taxes in Israel."

verses.kjv: And David spake to the men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?
verses.ct: David asked the men standing near him, "What will be done for the man who kills this Philistine and removes this disgrace from Israel? Who does this uncircumcised Philistine think he is, that he can mock the armies of the living God?"

verses.kjv: And the people answered him after this manner, saying, So shall it be done to the man that killeth him.
verses.ct: The soldiers repeated the same thing, telling him, "That's what will be given to the man who kills him."

verses.kjv: And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men; and Eliab’s anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why camest thou down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy pride, and the naughtiness of thine heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.
verses.ct: When Eliab, David's oldest brother, overheard him talking to the soldiers, he became furious with David. "Why did you even come here? And who did you dump those few sheep on out in the wilderness? I know how arrogant you are and how mischievous your heart is — you just came down to watch the fighting."

verses.kjv: And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?
verses.ct: David replied, "What did I do wrong? Can't I even ask a question?"

verses.kjv: And he turned from him toward another, and spake after the same manner: and the people answered him again after the former manner.
verses.ct: He turned to someone else and asked the same thing, and the soldiers gave him the same answer as before.

verses.kjv: And when the words were heard which David spake, they rehearsed them before Saul: and he sent for him.
verses.ct: When people reported what David had been saying, Saul sent for him.

verses.kjv: And David said to Saul, Let no man’s heart fail because of him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.
verses.ct: David told Saul, "No one should lose courage because of this Philistine. Your servant will go and fight him."

verses.kjv: And Saul said to David, Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him: for thou art but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.
verses.ct: Saul responded, "You can't go up against this Philistine and fight him. You're just a boy, and he's been a warrior his entire life."

verses.kjv: And David said unto Saul, Thy servant kept his father’s sheep, and there came a lion, and a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock:
verses.ct: But David said to Saul, "Your servant has been shepherding his father's flock. When a lion or a bear came and carried off a lamb from the flock,

verses.kjv: And I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered it out of his mouth: and when he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and smote him, and slew him.
verses.ct: I went after it, struck it, and rescued the lamb from its jaws. When it turned on me, I grabbed it by its mane, struck it, and killed it.

verses.kjv: Thy servant slew both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied the armies of the living God.
verses.ct: Your servant has killed both lions and bears, and this uncircumcised Philistine will end up just like them, since he has mocked the armies of the living God."

verses.kjv: David said moreover, The LORD that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said unto David, Go, and the LORD be with thee.
verses.ct: David added, "The LORD who rescued me from the claws of the lion and the claws of the bear will rescue me from this Philistine." Saul said to David, "Go, and may the LORD be with you."

verses.kjv: And Saul armed David with his armour, and he put an helmet of brass upon his head; also he armed him with a coat of mail.
verses.ct: Saul outfitted David with his own armor — he placed a bronze helmet on David's head and dressed him in a coat of armor.

verses.kjv: And David girded his sword upon his armour, and he assayed to go; for he had not proved it. And David said unto Saul, I cannot go with these; for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.
verses.ct: David strapped Saul's sword over the armor and tried to walk around, but he wasn't used to any of it. David told Saul, "I can't move in all this — I've never worn anything like it." So he took it all off.

verses.kjv: And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd’s bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.
verses.ct: Instead, he picked up his shepherd's staff, selected 5 smooth stones from the stream, and dropped them into the pouch of his shepherd's bag. Then, with his sling in hand, he approached the Philistine.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine came on and drew near unto David; and the man that bare the shield went before him.
verses.ct: Goliath moved closer to David, with his shield-bearer walking ahead of him.

verses.kjv: And when the Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him: for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and of a fair countenance.
verses.ct: When the Philistine got a good look at David, he sneered at him with contempt — David was just a young man with a ruddy complexion and a handsome face.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine said unto David, Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staves? And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
verses.ct: The Philistine said to David, "Am I a dog, that you come at me with sticks?" Then he cursed David in the names of his gods.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine said to David, Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the fowls of the air, and to the beasts of the field.
verses.ct: The Philistine taunted David, "Come closer, and I'll feed your body to the birds and the wild animals."

verses.kjv: Then said David to the Philistine, Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a shield: but I come to thee in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast defied.
verses.ct: David answered the Philistine, "You come at me with a sword, a spear, and a javelin, but I come at you in the name of the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel's forces — the one you have mocked."

verses.kjv: This day will the LORD deliver thee into mine hand; and I will smite thee, and take thine head from thee; and I will give the carcases of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the air, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.
verses.ct: "Today the LORD will hand you over to me. I will strike you down and cut off your head. Today I will give the bodies of the Philistine army to the birds and wild animals, so that the whole earth will know that there is a God in Israel."

verses.kjv: And all this assembly shall know that the LORD saveth not with sword and spear: for the battle is the LORD’s, and he will give you into our hands.
verses.ct: "And everyone gathered here will know that the LORD does not save by sword and spear. This battle belongs to the LORD, and he will hand all of you over to us."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and came, and drew nigh to meet David, that David hastened, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
verses.ct: As Goliath moved forward to close the distance, David sprinted toward the battle line to meet the Philistine.

verses.kjv: And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sunk into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth.
verses.ct: David reached into his bag, pulled out a stone, slung it, and struck the Philistine right in the forehead. The stone embedded itself in his skull, and he crashed face-first to the ground.

verses.kjv: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
verses.ct: So David defeated the Philistine with nothing but a sling and a stone — he struck Goliath down and killed him without even having a sword in his hand.

verses.kjv: Therefore David ran, and stood upon the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw their champion was dead, they fled.
verses.ct: David ran over and stood on top of the Philistine. He grabbed Goliath's own sword, pulled it from its sheath, and finished him off by cutting off his head. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they ran.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until thou come to the valley, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even unto Gath, and unto Ekron.
verses.ct: The men of Israel and Judah surged forward with a shout and chased the Philistines all the way to the entrance of Gath and the gates of Ekron. Philistine dead and wounded littered the road to Shaaraim, all the way to Gath and Ekron.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they spoiled their tents.
verses.ct: After the Israelites returned from pursuing the Philistines, they plundered their camp.

verses.kjv: And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armour in his tent.
verses.ct: David took Goliath's head and brought it to Jerusalem, and he kept Goliath's weapons in his own tent.

verses.kjv: And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said unto Abner, the captain of the host, Abner, whose son is this youth? And Abner said, As thy soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.
verses.ct: Earlier, when Saul had watched David go out to face the Philistine, he asked Abner, the commander of the army, "Abner, whose son is that young man?" Abner replied, "As surely as you live, my king, I have no idea."

verses.kjv: And the king said, Enquire thou whose son the stripling is.
verses.ct: The king said, "Find out whose son this young man is."

verses.kjv: And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
verses.ct: When David came back after killing the Philistine, Abner brought him before Saul. David was still carrying Goliath's head.

verses.kjv: And Saul said to him, Whose son art thou, thou young man? And David answered, I am the son of thy servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.
verses.ct: Saul asked him, "Whose son are you, young man?" David answered, "I am the son of your servant Jesse, from Bethlehem."
